posts.post_content: It's a common B sorcery. What did you expect, a functional reprint of [Inquisition of Kozilek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inquisition of Kozilek)? This is the lowest discard can go, and to make matters worse, gets in the way when I try to search for real mill cards. The only way this will see play, is if someone can make a [painful quandary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=painful quandary) deck before zen rotates out.
posts.html:
It's a common B sorcery. What did you expect, a functional reprint of Inquisition of Kozilek? posts.post_content:
In late game when your opponent is top-decking (which is common in my discard focused MBC that makes heavy use of [Black Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Sun's Zenith) as well) this card is less vulnerable to the card-type limitations that [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress), [Despise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Despise),[Thoughtseize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thoughtseize), and [Inquisition of Kozilek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inquisition of Kozilek) (all of which are AWESOME cards btw) have.   
  
OK, so you can't choose which card they have to ditch--not as big a deal when they don't have too many, right? I use this in my casual MBC where their hand has already been abused by other discard spells, specters, and board wipes.
posts.html:

OK, so you can't choose which card they have to ditch--not as big a deal when they don't have too many, right? I use this in my casual MBC where their hand has already been abused by other discard spells, specters, and board wipes.

posts.post_content: This card might not let you scout out ahead, but at the same time, if they have anything in their hand, something will be going to the graveyard, unlike a lot of other ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) Sorcery speed discards that have the potential to just fizzle out. Hell, this one hits two cards, and can brutalize people relying on the top of their deck. It's like the absolute bane of [Magus of the Future](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Future).
posts.html:
This card might not let you scout out ahead, but at the same time, if they have anything in their hand, something will be going to the graveyard, unlike a lot of other Sorcery speed discards that have the potential to just fizzle out. Hell, this one hits two cards, and can brutalize people relying on the top of their deck. It's like the absolute bane of Magus of the Future.

Posted By: DoragonShinzui (7/22/2012 7:09:32 PM)

posts.post_content:
**IN SUMMARY**  
Cannot see hand  
They choose the Card  
1 card is irreverent, equal chance of hurting or helping them. *(If you could see there topdeck or if they cast ponder, then it would be a relevant ability.)*  
Wheres the card advantage? *(Your spending mana & loosing a card in your hand so they can choose to ditch there weakest link.)*  
  
  
Compare to all the other ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) discard spells. This is one of the weakest ones by far. Not everyone plays blue, but I must admit its a very strong response to [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder), or anything else that involves top deck management. In standard I would main deck [Despise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Despise) and put this in my sideboard for control decks. Its just to weak of a spell against every other deck.
posts.html:

1 card is irreverent, equal chance of hurting or helping them. (If you could see there topdeck or if they cast ponder, then it would be a relevant ability.)
Wheres the card advantage? (Your spending mana & loosing a card in your hand so they can choose to ditch there weakest link.)


Compare to all the other discard spells. This is one of the weakest ones by far. Not everyone plays blue, but I must admit its a very strong response to Ponder, or anything else that involves top deck management. In standard I would main deck Despise and put this in my sideboard for control decks. Its just to weak of a spell against every other deck.

posts.post_content:
This is a very underestimated card. Why? [Liliana's Caress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana's Caress) ran with [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress), [Mind Rot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Rot), [Dispise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dispise) & [Psychic Miasma](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Psychic Miasma).   
  
Turn one you can use either Duress (remove spell: counter spell) or Horrifying Revelation (to get card advantage).Turn two, Liliana's Caress and mill/discard & control for the rest of the game. Another under-rated card if used well.   
  
I'd probably run [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe) to get the draw & keep tabs along with [Liliana Vess](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana Vess) for good measure.
posts.html:
This is a very underestimated card. Why? Liliana's Caress ran with Duress, Mind Rot, Dispise & Psychic Miasma.

Turn one you can use either Duress (remove spell: counter spell) or Horrifying Revelation (to get card advantage).Turn two, Liliana's Caress and mill/discard & control for the rest of the game. Another under-rated card if used well.

I'd probably run Gitaxian Probe to get the draw & keep tabs along with Liliana Vess for good measure.
